Message.Text: Tommy, I don't get why we're still talking about SQL. NoSQL seems more appropriate for the flexibility this project needs, don't you think?
Wait, I thought the project requirements were more relational? SQL makes sense for structured data. Are you sure NoSQL is what you mean?
But isn't the data supposed to scale and change over time? NoSQL should handle that better. Or maybe I misunderstood the project scope?
Hmm, now I'm not sure either. Are we talking about the same project? We should probably clarify exactly what the requirements are before deciding.
